page.title: 18THE VILLAGE SHOP
page.content: There are two small sub-post office- shops in this area.One is the village shop at Swaffham Bulbeck. Altogether seven people work in the shop.Including 4 part time. They get most of their stock from Copeman and Ridley.It makes supplies from Iswitch.They also deliver things. The shop is owned by Mr. and Mrs. Upton.Their hours are : on weekdays 7am-6pm and on Saturdays 7.30am-1pm. The post office is at the far end of the shop and is small but most of the village uses it.They sell stamps and have a small post-office bank account. The sub-post-office-shop all in all is very handy for the people of the village Unfortunately for the village shop most people get their groceries from supermarkets in Cambridge and Newmarket.
